items.description: You are here: GSG English Home > Games

items.content:
Instructions

Have one person read these instructions out loud!

  • Find at least three (max = eight) classmates growing towards
    CB1
    .
  • Collect two devices. One to record the story (audio only) and one to use as a timer.
  • Sit in around one table, make sure you sit in a closed circle.
  • Choose a starter sentence and a set of words from the list or make your own. Talk about what the starter sentence means and what the words mean. Talk about each word before you start and make sure everyone knows what the words mean. You can use a dictionary.
  • Write down the starter sentence and the story words on piece of paper. Use big letters so the words and sentence are visible to everyone. Place the piece of paper in the middle of the table, leave the marker next to it.
  • Make sure you have the looped countdown timer ready. Set it to 10 seconds and 'No Loop Limit (Forever)'. Press 'Set'.

Use this countdown timer with a loop.

Instructions:

  • The youngest person starts. Go clockwise.
  • The story can't end before all words have been used. Make sure someone crosses them out after they have been used.
  • A person who can't think of a matching sentence within ten seconds gets a letter (BOOM!). This means four mistakes. When someone has BOOM it means GAME OVER for them. They can rejoin the next round.
  • If a person uses one of the words from the list in their sentence they can remove a BOOM letter if they have one. If they use the word without having any BOOM letters nothing happens. However, the word is removed from the list. You can make it harder for people to remove BOOM letters if you use up all the words from the list.
  • Each new story starts with an empty BOOM card unless you choose otherwise. Discuss this beforehand. If you're a strong team it might be more fun to take the BOOM score to each new round.

Starter packages

starter sentence 1

  • Pay attention to the tense! This story is about something that is happening right now!
  • It might be wise to talk about what it means to talk about now.
  • Starter sentence is: "Look at that building! People are dancing on its roof! Awesome!"

A Words

  • above
  • abroad
  • absent
  • accompany
  • ache
  • access
  • afford
  • afterwards
  • ancient
  • attach
  • annual
  • approve
  • atmosphere
  • appear
  • altogether

starter sentence 2

  • Pay attention to the tense! This story is about something that happened in the past and no longer affects the present.
  • It might be wise to talk about what it means to talk about the past.
  • Starter sentence is: "Once upon a time >name< and >name< (and >name<) were walking in a wood."

B Words

  • borrow
  • bother
  • branch
  • bunch
  • by accident
  • by hand
  • besides
  • bitter
  • because of
  • behaviour
  • badly
  • backwards
  • born
  • brave

starter sentence 3

  • Pay attention to the tense! This story is about something that is going to happen / will happen!
  • It might be wise to talk about what it means to talk about the future.
  • Starter sentence is: "Tomorrow this time, we'll be sunbathing on the beach! Yea!"

C Words

  • complete
  • contain
  • careful
  • confirm
  • casual
  • condition
  • colourful
  • carry out
  • consider
  • complaint
  • convenient

starter sentence 4

  • Pay attention to the tense! This story is about something that has already happened several times up to the present.
  • It might be wise to talk about what it means to talk about unfinished sequenced occurences.
  • Starter sentence is: "Have you heard? They have gone to that abandoned building like twenty times already. No one knows what they do in there. What do you guys think?"

D Words

  • damage
  • dangerous
  • decide
  • decorate
  • decrease
  • defeat
  • definitely
  • degree
  • delay
  • description
  • demand
  • develop
  • disappear
  • disadvantage
  • disease
  • divide
  • dozen
  • during

starter sentence 5

  • Pay attention to the tense! This story is about something that has been happening.
  • It might be wise to talk about what it means to talk about something that started in the past and has continued continuously up to this point.
  • Starter sentence is: "Should we help that guy? He has been alone and crying at that table for like half an hour!"

E Words

  • each
  • earn
  • easygoing
  • either
  • embarrassed
  • emergency
  • end up
  • engineer
  • enough
  • entrance
  • equipment
  • especially
  • exhange
  • except
  • excitement
  • excuse
  • explain
  • extraordinary

starter sentence 6

  • Pay attention to the tense! This story is about something that was happening for some time in the past.
  • It might be wise to talk about what it means to talk about something that was happening for some time in the past.
  • Starter sentence is: "So the other day, I was walking to school and I saw two adult people. The strange thing was, they were climbing a tree!"

F Words

  • familiar
  • fancy
  • fare
  • fasten
  • figure
  • fine
  • fond
  • dog
  • fold
  • forecast
  • fortunately
  • frequent
  • foreign
  • fully
  • furthest

starter sentence 7

  • Pay attention to the tense! This story is about something that happens all the time.
  • It might be wise to talk about what it means to talk about something that happens all the time.
  • Starter sentence is: "Every Sunday my neighbour gets in his car at precisely 8:50 . He comes back at 21:00 sharp. What do you guys think he does? He drives in the direction of the old castle up the road."

G Words

  • gap
  • generally
  • generous
  • get in
  • get down
  • get on
  • glance
  • give way
  • grab
  • giant
  • gentle
  • global warming
  • giraffe
  • get off

starter sentence 8

  • Starter sentence is: "Yesterday I went to school and realised..."

H Words

  • habit
  • hand-held
  • hand out
  • handsome
  • harbour
  • hardly
  • hardware
  • headline
  • height
  • hidden
  • hitchhike
  • hire
  • hopeless
  • huge
  • humid
  • herb

starter sentence 9

  • Starter sentence is: "Tomorrow I'm going to the hospital to..."

I Words

  • imagination
  • identification
  • important
  • improve
  • imagine
  • illness
  • immigration
  • independent
  • including
  • initial
  • increase
  • indoors
  • in order to
  • instance
  • instead of
  • intend
  • interrupt
  • in the end
  • invent
  • involve
  • itself

starter sentence 10

  • Starter sentence is: "Do you guys here that? It's a train. A train? In the city centre?"

J Words

  • jam
  • jealous
  • jet
  • journalist
  • join
  • jump
  • jungle
  • journey
  • jewellery
  • jar

starter sentence 11

  • Starter sentence is: "She has passed all her exams. She had studied really hard..."

K words

  • keen
  • keep on
  • keep up
  • kettle
  • kind
  • knock down
  • kowledge

starter sentence 12

  • Starter sentence is: ""

L words

starter sentence 13

  • Starter sentence is: ""

M words

starter sentence 14

  • Starter sentence is: ""

N words

starter sentence 15

  • Starter sentence is: ""

O words

starter sentence 16

  • Starter sentence is: ""

P words

starter sentence 17

  • Starter sentence is: ""

Q words

starter sentence 18

  • Starter sentence is: ""

R words

starter sentence 19

  • Starter sentence is: ""

S words

starter sentence 20

  • Starter sentence is: ""

T words

starter sentence 21

  • Starter sentence is: ""

U words

starter sentence 22

  • Starter sentence is: ""

starter sentence 23

  • Starter sentence is: ""

w words

starter sentence 24

  • Starter sentence is: ""

starter sentence 25

  • Starter sentence is: ""

starter sentence 26

  • Starter sentence is: ""
